Easily one of the best games I’ve ever played on the iPad.  Challenging, free form play with a nice progression.  Completely worth the price, in fact, worth twice the price easily.  Only one negative... a little anti-climatic.  I worked hard, played hard, convoyed the last level, and... nothing. End of game. Sort of wanted a reward. The cake is a lie indeed. ;)

I love this game. It is one of the best bridge building games I’ve played. The only problem is that my game keeps getting reset. I have made it to level 30 5 times and my progress gets reset and I have to start over from scratch. If this problem didn’t exist I would definitely rate this game 5 stars.

title.label: Was a great twist on the bridge building theme

content.label: After playing the first 2 games, this isn’t exactly what I expected for the next portal game to be, and upon first glance, I expected a normal boring bridge builder. But the way this game was developed changed my mind completely. This game will remain one of my favorite mobile games for a long while to come

If you are looking for a good time waster and a good belly laugh, look no further. I woke my wife up while playing this game. Yep, laughed my a** off! This nice little gem will also keep you thinking while amusing you. Super cool graphics and back ground. Well done to say the least. Best bridge builder I’ve ever played.

Fun, leisure physics puzzler. I own this for PS4 and iPhone, and play both. (iPhone when calming down for the night/ pre-bed.)

I recommend this to everything that enjoys physics based puzzlers. 60 levels. Cannot be steered wrong on the side of value here.

title.label: The bridge is not alive, do not attempt to insult.

content.label: Who knew building bridges was so darn tough? Not even the US President. It’s tough to learn if you’ve never built a bridge before, but soon I was delivering lift trucks like a real engineer with real struts. I bet I could design some bridges now for Illinois, what with the money they have. 17/17 would recommend.
Fun engaging and a good story. If you love the building genre in the bridge sector download this now and thank yourself later!
Really neat

title.label: Very little GLaDOS. No portal placement.

content.label:
It’s a bridge construction game. It gets difficult as others have said. Im about halfway through. I’m going to request a refund. 

I’m most disappointed in the limited GLaDOS appearances. No taunting during the level. No commentary on gaining achievements. No pithy comment on level completion to take you down a peg. No over arching story. She doesn’t even make an appearance every level! 

Part of what made portal great was the developing relationship between you and GLaDOS. You don’t get that here. There’s very little story. 

You also get zero control of the physics in the puzzles. All the portals are static. The logic of the pathing part of the puzzle is often obvious. This is more a test of building a structure strong enough with limited anchor points. 

Often you’re building the same basic structure, but there’s no ability to copy+paste, make templates, or move a group of points together, so much of your time is spent carefully rebuilding the same lattice. 

If you already love bridge building games, this is prob a nice addition to your collection. But I bet the other titles by this same publisher may have better puzzles. 

If you’re mostly here to spend more time in the Aperture Science Testing Facility, I’d caution this title is too meticulous for how little atmosphere there is. The devs could have had an amazing story, but it would require 3-5 times the voice acting. As it stands, it feels like a tacked on theme.

When you try to move a connection, you press and hold, and just when you start move it, the the connection (or joint) *jumps up above* your finger or Apple Pencil which completely throws me off. It’s like if you were doing a jigsaw puzzle, and you select a piece to move, but when you go to move it, then the piece above your selected pieces is the one that moves. Why?
Just got done searching for Gaming PC parts and found this. I played the portal series and this is fun. Did I mention it’s fun?

title.label: Based on portal, but not very true to it’s spirt

content.label:
This game is reasonably fun, and it’s nice to finally have another portal-esq game. However, this game seems to offer a heavily diluted version of the portal experience. GlaDOS’s personality has been made much more mild, and lost much of the humor that made portal great. For an example of the differences, while in Portal 2 you are told “if you encounter killer androids, rest assured that they have all been provided a copy of the laws of robotics - to share.” Contrasting to this game when GLaDOS says “remember that you have been granted unlimited access to the book of best practices.” Where’s GLaDOS’ snarky humor?! Why can’t she at least say something to the effect of “Remember that referencing the book of best practices has been shown to increase test subjects survival times by up to 48.72%”?! This is not the only example where it seems GLaDOS’ (and Aperture’s) humor has been dumbed down and written by people who watched a ten minute video of portal gameplay, then decided to modify it to be more children friendly. 

Also this game completely disregards the dual color behavior of portals after the first level, without even attempting to remain faithful to the combinations in the original games. I understand they wanted to make it less confusing when there were multiple sets of portals, but they could still have matched the multiple portal color dynamics that Portal 2’s Co-Op has.

Also what is the point of tracking the number of vehicles in the “convoy mode”, if only 100% of them crossing grants completion. Why not count any number of successful crossings, and give the score as a fraction?

On another positive note, this game is not plagued by the terrible microtransactions that have been ruining many other recent mobile games. I just hope the developers have the self control to keep it that way in the long term.

If you haven’t played the real portal games yet, stop reading this and go play them both immediately. They are far better than this (or just about any other) game(s), and I highly recommend them.

Overall I would still recommend this game to Portal fans, but know you are getting a very heavily diluted portal experience. I am still holding out hope for the mythical Portal 3, which this game is certainly not.
Some of the later levels get so complex and have so many moving parts that it ends up being a real exercise in focus and puzzle solving. Highly recommended.

Game is very fun and entertaining, however the mechanics and controls could use a bit of polish. Zooming in and out of the map can make the whole camera freak out, and trying to grab a specific piece or joint can be a bit challenging. Other than that, I absolutely love the game and the crude humor.

Okay it ain’t portal - BUT it brings back the nostalgia and using the portals and knocking out lazerbots is still a blast. Plus there’s so many options to create your own route that u can always go back and try different set ups. Never thought bridge building would distract me for hours but I love this game. Hurry up and make new levels or part 2!!!
